inn1.comm: tidy start from Anderson, zipping an outswinger past off stump and Watson leaves it alone
ooh, bit loose from Watson, Anderson got this to jag away off the seam and Watson fenced at it, no harm done though and Kieswetter collects
Australia are off, in gentle fashion, another outswinger finds the outer half of the bat and runs away for a single backwards of point
Anderson searches for an inswinger and duly fires it down leg for a wide
better here, adjusting to outside off stump, Paine, who has a face far more gentle than his name, leaves well alone
swing again, nice to see some movement in the air, Paine looks carefully and leaves it alone
Paine is off and running, nudging the ball to mid on and scampering through for a single. Decent first over for both sides you'd think
well, the delivery is far more gentle than the hair-do, floated up and Paine pushes a straight drive down the ground for four, with minimum of fuss
ah, good response here, quicker, better length, jagging away and Paine plays and misses
good cricket here, full, touch of movement and Paine defends tidily
another ball fractionally overpitched, Paine pushed a drive down the ground via an inside edge, and collects a couple
another good response from Bresnan, this bounced and left Paine and he could only flinch at it outside off stump
tidy finish to the over, fuller, some away movement and Paine lets it go by
tidy stuff here again from Anderson, outside off and Watson leaves alone
fuller this time, Watson leans into a solid defensive block. He's a serious unit Watson.
oh good ball here, some late movement away from the bat, Watson thinks about a cut and is beaten outside off
another probing delivery, looks like it will be good Jimmy today, fullish, Watson plays around a defensive block a touch and it squirts to point
this time Watson is more crisp and sure, blocking firmly to cover
Anderson completes a good over with Watson full-facing it back to the bowler
good delivery this, Paine stretches forward and defends a touch uneasily
Bresnan is lucky to get away with this, it was short and wide but Paine could not time his cut shot at all
touch fortunate for Paine this time, skews off an outside edge down to third man for a single
tidy stuff here, Bresnan jumps wide of the crease and angles this into Watson, who defends
the minute the ball is in his half, Watson really winds up for a big crisp drive, he really plays the shot well, but this time straight to a fielder at cover

good shot I guess, Watson didn't time it at all, but with the field up the shot was on, it was a touch short from Bresnan and Watson tried to front-foot pull it, didn't get much of it but it went down towards the long on boundary, pitched and died, like a real golfer's chip
nothing fancy attempted by Watson here, just old-fashioned forward defence
once again Watson plays this out the coaching manual, defending into the off side
oops, really Watson should have punished this, a touch of width and Watson slashed hard at thin air
bit of an appeal here from Anderson as he angled this into the stumps, Watson got an inside edge though, and it was probably going over the top. Not out really.
good response from Watson, top shot this, touch too short and wide from Anderson and Watson murdered it, thumping behind point for four
two in two! Anderson goes full this time so Watson unleashes his big front-foot drive, banging it past Anderson for four more
Paine is always the more sedate of the two openers and here he works Bresnan quietly to square leg
this is a touch ambitious, Paine gives himself room, aiming to carve one over cover, but misses the ball entirely
less expansive here, dropping a fullish delivery into the off side
good ball here, Paine commits early to a forward defence and is forced to play around his pad a fraction
this time it's a more conventional defensive block, good pressure here from Bresnan
very good, the two boundaries that ended the last over were followed by a maiden here from Bresnan, just restricting Australia's run rate
very accurate start from Broad, just outside off stump on a length and Watson defends
well, it's a simple game, go full to Watson and be punished. That's exactly what happened here, it was full, Watson planted his front leg down the pitch and thumped it over cover for four
very lucky escape here for Broad, he went full and down the leg side, Watson clipped round the corner but picked out the short fine leg
this time it's back to a decent length and Watson blocks and collects a single
Paine has not really got going yet, and here he blocks off the front foot
touch of extra bounce, Paine works it to point very carefully. He's got 8 from 20
solid stuff from Bresnan, not much on offer, back of a length, on off stump, Watson blocks
England look intent not to pitch up to Watson, and fair enough, this is back of a length and dabbed into the midwicket region
touch fuller this time, Watson rocks forward and blocks
poor delivery this, shoved down the leg side and with fine leg up, it's help-yourself time, Watson duly does, wheeling it round the corner for four
much better this time, back of a length on the stumps, Watson can only defend
neatly played by Watson to finish the over, opening the face and guiding a cut down to third man for a single
Watson looking in good touch, defending this very firmly back to the bowler
action replay here, on a length and line, and defended
this skids through a fraction outside off stump, Watson aims a cut shot but it's a touch too close for the shot and it ghosts past the edge
nicely done from Watson, dabbing this into the leg side and scampering through for a swift single
well done the pitch! Oval bounce here, it was a touch short and leapt up, over Paine's cut shot and carried on climbing, eventually bursting through Kieswetter's gloves
tidy finish to a tidy over, well defended by Watson

all over for Paine! He's struggled today and it was a tame end. He tried to work it into the leg side, got a leading edge and looped very gently to Morgan at cover. Bresnan has his first wicket in the series!
Watson very casually guides this down to third man for a single
good start to the new man, Bresnan goes full and straight, Pointing jumps into a forward block
good start, Ponting jumps into a forward block
good line to Ponting, outside off stump, Ponting leaves. I'd rather a slip than the two short men catching, but we shall see
poor finish to the over, slipped down the leg side, Ponting clips it for four.
on off stump, defended back to the bowler
hits the pitch hard and Watson pushes square into the covers
a punchy back-foot drive this time, but straight to square cover
loses his line onto leg stump, worked down to fine leg
ooh, banged in short and Ponting goes for a pull which he splices over the man very close at short midwicket and it lobs wide of mid-on
nicely timed with a drive off the back foot but straight to the man at cover
outside off, takes a big stride into the shot and defends to cover
good line, back of a length on off stump and Ponting defends towards the bowler
stays on the back foot and opens the face into the off side
beautiful timing from Ponting, Bresnan drifts a little too straight and is clipped perfectly between deep square and fine leg
glorious...so much for dodgy form as Ponting leans into a drive, on the up, which bisects cover and mid off. It wasn't a bad ball, just top batting
responds with a bouncer which is too short according to the umpire so he'll have to bowl that again
targets the pads, was lucky that wasn't dispatched as well with Ponting clipping straight to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, Watson defends with an open face to backward point
lovely shot as he waits for this one outside off then glides it through the vacant slip cordon and it races away
takes his eyes off a short ball as he pulls rather ungainly through the legside but safe of any fielders
full outside off stump, met with a big stride as Ponting drives into the covers...beats cover and mid-off cleans up
drives into the pitch and it bounces back towards Broad
gee, what a shot that is, as Watson picks a slower ball and dispatches straight down the ground into the sightscreen with a free swing of the arms
round the wicket, on leg stump and worked out to deep midwicket
outside off, defended softly into the off side
punched down the ground to long-on
pushed off the back foot to long-off
whipped nicely off leg stump and beats midwicket with good placement
dropped down the leg side, missed by Kieswetter and not called wide...was there an edge? Or was it pad?
outside off and left alone, Kieswetter doesn't collect this one cleanly either
full on middle stump, nicely driven down the on side but the mid-on is very straight and cuts it off
banged in short outside off, must have been close to a wide as Ponting just swayed out of the way
defends from off stump with an open face and finds backward point
good ball, lifting off a length with some extra pace but Ponting is equal to it and pushes into the off side

spoils a good over, but it's not all Broad's fault...Ponting drives a wide ball over backward point and Bresnan makes a horrid mess of the save at third man as the ball goes through his legs...not good
tossed up a touch more, driven firmly back to Yardy
pushed straight down the ground
driven nicely into the covers but Collingwood makes a good save
worked off leg stump into the midwicket area and can't beat the fielder
nudged into the leg side again, this time just wide of the fielder and although Watson is a little slow he's comfortable enough
a neat punch to long-on to end the over
onto the back foot and whipped to short midwicket
tossed up outside off, Watson leans forward and defends

gone! Would you believe it, Watson has picked out deep midwicket with absolute precision as he went for a slog sweep. Eoin Morgan barely had to take step and Watson can barely drag himself away...he's been in good form but hasn't converted
turned from off stump to midwicket
uses his feet and works this from outside down to long-on
pushed gently into the leg side
back of a length on middle, Clarke easily behind the line and defends
another short one and pulled away down to fine leg
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
short one to the captain, pulled uppishly towards fine leg but it lands short of the fielder...still, not convincing, and that's how he fell at the Rose Bowl
good delivery, short of a length on off stump, but well played as Clarke drops it into the off side with soft hands and Ponting is quick to call him through
walks across the crease and defends solidly down to mid-off
steps back and drives out to the deep cover sweeper
attacking line outside off, Ponting comes forward and defends square
turned from off stump to the man at square leg
whipped from outside off, midwicket gets a hand on it but can't stop the run as it is parried to long-on
worked straight to midwicket this time
down the pitch, nice flight from Swann, and Clarke can only clip to square leg
on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
pitched up on off stump, Ponting drives but without timing this one and picks out mid-off
banged in short, that came right out of the screws as Ponting pulls but it races straight to deeps square
banged in short and it flies down the leg side which makes it an easy call for the umpire
back of a length, Clarke hops into line and defends to the off side
that's a good bouncer over off stump, Clarke sways out of the line
stays short of a length but Clarke is equal to it and defends to mid-on
good from Swann, flighting it and holding it back a touch, Ponting carefully defends off the front foot
nicely played, skipped down the wicket and clipped in front of midwicket for a single
neatly done from Clarke, milking it down the ground for one
touch too short this time, allows Ponting to get back and cut behind point for a single
dropped by Anderson! you'd expect better from him, Clarke danced down the track and scythed a cover drive straight to Anderson at short cover, but it burst through the hands
Clarke this time casually works it down the ground for another single
and starts well enough, outside off stump, Clarke's back-foot drive finds no timing and it trickles out to cover
touch wide from Anderson and some very good running allows Clarke to collect two from an outside-edge that goes out to third man
another fielding mishap, this time at point, a cut shot goes through the sliding fielder and allows a couple
Clarke is really throwing his hands at the ball outside off stump, the pitch is very true so he can get away with it, but the timing is not quite there
Anderson gets away with this, shoved full and down the leg side but Clarke misses the leg-side flick
Anderson reverts to a line just outside off, Clarke drives and it goes out to mid off
nicely played by Ponting, in total control as he walks down the wicket and works it down to long on
Clarke likes what he saw, so repeats the shot
top stuff from the batsmen, having milked the good balls for singles, this time Ponting punishes the short ball, cutting crisply, well in front of square for four to deep cover
the boundary is followed up by a gentle work for a single round the corner
nicely done from Clarke, working into space in the leg side for a couple
full and flighted from Swann, and Clarke tickles it into the midwicket region for a single, good over for Australia
looks a very good pitch for batting, coming on to the bat nicely, not much movement, here Clarke's leg-side flick finds mid on
outside off stump here and Clarke is completely disinterested, leaving it well alone
good ball from Anderson, back of a length, outside off stump and Clarke defends to point
good shot, really good stuff to relieve the pressure, edges down the ground and gives himself a touch of room, carves it over cover to collect four
Anderson's response is short and a touch wide outside off, too wide for the umpire's liking
wow, really nicely played here, very good timing, Clarke edged down the wicket and leant on the ball to send it skimming through midwicket for four. Very quick outfield here
another good over for Australia, Clarke cuts this to deep point to keep the strike
flatter from Swann, and a touch quicker, Clarke dabs it to short midwicket
fraction short outside off, finds some spin, Clarke is a good player of spin and guides it down to third man
nicely bowled here, touch slower and given more air, Clarke came down the wicket but missed his leg-side nurdle
this time it's quicker and flatter and Clarke pushes it past short midwicket for a single
Ponting calmly and crisply works this down the ground for a single
quicker ball to finish, Clarke tried to dab it behind square on the off side, but got too much of the ball
good start from Yardy and Ponting stretches forward and defends
touch more air here, and Ponting pushes it gently down the ground for a single
Clarke similarly clips it down the ground for a single, very simple stuff it seems
touch shorter and quicker, the cut shot wasn't timed at all and it went one-bounce to Strauss at point. Pointing's 13,000th ODI run. Good god!
once again it's pushed gently and comfortably down the ground for a single
Ponting completes the over by milking one down the ground
very good from Swann, flight, a touch of drift, Pointing stretches forward defends, and it comes off the outside edge for a single to point
Clarke reads the script perfectly and milks a single down the ground for one
this time it's a touch leg-sided and nibbled for one to square leg
pushed away for a single past point
dot ball this time, Ponting tried to ease a single down the ground but Swann was swiftly across to intercept
top shot, really good to finish the over. Ponting down on one knee and sweeping firmly behind square for a welcome boundary
Clarke trying to find a gap behind point but the angle into him from Yardy is too strong and he can't quite control it as he'd like
touch shorter this time but the cut shot finds short third man
this time Clarke gets the single, angling in front of midwicket for one
another single here, Ponting pushing very securely down the wicket
Clarke skips down the track and carefully works the ball to long on
good finish from Ponting again, this time he's down the track, giving himself a fraction of room and driving through extra cover for a couple
bustles in and, as have all the England bowlers today, starts very well, on a length and line, defended back down the pitch
similar ball, Clarke is a touch hurried in defence, pushes it back to the bowler

top fielding there by the stumps! Clarke crisply struck a perfectly straight drive, but it clattered into the stumps at the non-striker's end. Luckily for Ponting, who was well out his ground, the bowler couldn't get a hand on it
top fielding again, but this time it's by Anderson, another full ball is clattered by Clarke, but Anderson's dive at cover saved the boundary
well, full on leg stump, asking for punishment, but the leg-side clip picks out midwicket
somehow, this over has only gone for two as Ponting drives down the ground. Lucky for England that
Yardy will be quite pleased with this, a gentle full toss is bunted down the ground for just a single
Clarke this time edges down the wicket and full-faces to long on
Ponting stretches forward and dabs a single to cover
good timing here earns Clarke a couple, pushed firmly and perfectly straight
similar shot, but this time the timing is a fraction worse so long on scoots round to field
touch shorter from Ponting, he gets back and drives to long on for a single
driven square through the covers, nicely placed and enough to bring up Ponting's fifty...a steady innings
tucked off leg stump out to deep square
driven at the top of the bounce down to long-off
fired down the leg side, flicks the pad and evades the diving Kieswetter towards fine leg who pulls it up just inside the boundary
works with the angle coming into him again down to fine leg
punched firmly down the pitch, well timed and Wright dives to his right to make a good save in his follow through
that's a top shot, hint of width outside off and driven on the up between cover and mid-off...Ponting at his best
goes straighter this time and Ponting drives towards mid-on who is inside the ring
outside off, opens the face down to third man
slower ball outside off, Ponting holds back on his shot then opens the face and finds backward point
well bowled, outside off and comes back at Ponting who defends awkwardly into the off side
good finish to the over, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
punched off the back foot down to long-off
drives without any time and it skews back to Wright
clears the in field, full on middle and although it wasn't quite timed he lofted it over straight midwicket and this outfield is so quick it was always four
drives out to deep cover
drives down to mid-on but not off the middle and there's no single
mid-on has dropped back now, so this is an easy single as he punches down the ground
banged in short and that was very easy for Clarke to pull it away off the front foot powerfully over midwicket
good comeback, slower ball on off stump and cramps Clarke for room as he tries to drive
full outside off, drives again without timing to cover
step across his crease outside off stump and works straight to midwicket
pushed up to mid-on and they scamper through
worked off the stumps down to long leg
on the stumps, worked back to the bowler
dragged down short, pulled away but he picks out square...that was begging for the boundary
comes forward and works down to long-on
worked off the stumps through midwicket and that takes Clarke to his fifty from 61 balls...a compact innings from the vice-captain
uses his feet, pushes down the pitch and Collingwood dives to field, in the process getting tangled around Ponting's legs
low full toss on leg stump but it only costs a single out to deep midwicket
steps back outside leg to give himself room and cuts hard through cover
tossed up and bunted down the ground to long-off
fired in at leg stump, whipped away out to deep square and they sprint hard between the wickets
uses his feet and drives inside-out to long-off
over the wicket now, full on leg stump and driven firmly back to Yardy
reverse sweep from Ponting, well played and well connected as he slots it backward of square through the off side
down the pitch and drives through the covers out to the sweeper
low full toss which is driven down the ground
dragged down short and pulled away over midwicket, one bounce and across the boundary
down the leg side, well taken by Kieswetter
flicked in the air wide of midwicket and down to long-on
skips down the track again and turns it along the ground through midwicket
opens the face and drives nicely through the covers, placement is excellent and allows them back for a second
around the wicket, worked away through midwicket
that's a lovely shot as he comes down the pitch outside leg and drives out extra cover...but the sweeper keeps them to a couple
tries to work into the leg side but goes straight back to Yardy
pushed down to long-on
well, some good cricket and not-so-good cricket there as Collingwood makes a fine save at cover but couldn't get the throw quite right with Ponting struggling to reach his ground at the striker's end
fielded by the bowler
opens the face into the covers
full and driven down to long-on which brings up the 200
cuts hard at some width, slots it through the covers and it beats a sprawling Bresnan at deep cover...that was always out of reach, but he's not had the best day in the field
down the pitch, drives in the air but one bounce to long-off
elegantly flicked over midwicket, a nice flourish from Ponting, and long-on runs around to field
steps back to leg, drives through the covers for another brace
round the wicket, outside leg stump and flicked out to deep square
cramped for room and pushed back to the bowler
worked in the air but bounces well short of long-on
pushed out to midwicket
drives past a diving Yardy down to long-off
driven hard along the ground through cover
Ponting rides some extra bounce outside off and pushed it to deep point for one
Anderson goes full this time, there looked a hint of in-drift, Clarke sliced out to third man for a single
no in drift there, just full and straight into the middle of Ponting's bat, luckily for England, the drive was straight to extra cover
quite close this, slower ball from Anderson drew Ponting into the shot too early, and his back-foot drive was wide of short extra
ooh, close again, another slower ball, Ponting down the track aiming a booming drive, but it skews off the outer-half and loops one bounce to long on
cracker to finish! Clarke nailed this, giving himself a touch of room and driving firmly wide of long off for four
this looked a tough call, arrowed down the leg side, Ponting missed the sweep but a bye and a wide for Australia
touch shorter from Yardy, Clarke's back-foot drive picks out short extra
Clarke edges down the wicket, sets up for a big shot but clips a single to mid on instead
this time it's worked into the point region for one
Clarke edging down the wicket once more, Yardy fires it in even quicker, and Clarke's drive can't beat the fielder
once again Clarke can't beat Yardy as it's darted in
lovely shot to finish, flicked firmly towards deep square leg, who runs round and slides to field and prevent the boundary

well, how about that. Powerplay has gone wrong straight away! Ponting aimed a drive over cover but couldn't quite time it and instead chipped it firmly to Strauss at extra cover who leapt and took the chance.
beaten first ball! Just hangs his bat outside off stump, flat footed, and the ball whistles past the edge
this time White connects, with a similarly uncertain defensive prod
much easier delivery here, shorter and White wheels a pull shot down to fine leg
this is good from Anderson, pitching full, finding a hint of movement, Clarke drives to cover
Clarke backs away to try and get some room but Anderson follows him so he can only squeeze a drive to mid on for one
first ball is quickish and back of a length, Clarke aims an enormous mow over extra cover, but mises
good slower ball here and it's tough for Clarke, muscling the ball over the boundary isn't really his idea of a good time, instead he swishes hard without timing to mid off
outside edge was running down quickly to the third man boundary but Yardy scooted around and slid and picked up in an instant, top fielding that
White backs away, aiming a big off-side shot, Broad follows him, choking him for room and he ends up dabbing to cover for one
really good bowling this from Broad, so far neither of the Australian batsmen can get him away, angled in short and into Clarke's body, he guides it to point for one
Broad may just have got away with one here, there was some width outside off and White aimed a furious cut, but didn't quite time it and it went out to third man for one
ooh, White almost picks out mid off with a bunt down the ground, it landed just short
finally Clarke gets one through the infield, he backed away, Anderson followed him but he managed still to squeeze a drive down the ground, past a diving mid off for four
Anderson's response is to change the length, banging it in much shorter and Clarke whips it straight to midwicket
short again, Clarke pulls again, more firmly and it goes over the infield to deep midwicket

White chips down the ground, not quite timing it, but it was arrow straight so Pietersen, running round from long on, had no chance of catching it and instead collected it one-bounce in front of the boundary
another big drive down the ground, where long off fields
Broad goes full here, and it's squeezed to point where Strauss tumbles as he fields, keeping it to one
slower ball bouncer, very difficult to get much leverage in that, Clarke instead pulls down to deep midwicket for one
very nicely bowled, not much White could do but defend back to the bowler, the scampered a single but if Broad had collected cleanly, it might have been close
banged in short and this really zipped off the wicket, looks a good pitch, it climbed over Clarke's attempted pull shot and was still on its way up when Kieswetter collected
Clarke brings up the Australian 250 with a very simple cross-bat club down the ground, it was a touch short and the shot cleared a jumping Pietersen at mid on
good finish from Broad, angled into the body and worked to mid off for a swift single
good ball from Anderson, full and straight, whipped to midwicket where a diving stop keeps it to two
short ball here, slower again, Clarke pulls but without much power and picks out deep midwicket
well, it wasn't quite where bear-man White planned, but he'll take all of it, he aimed an enormous slog, it came off the outside edge, zipping wide of short third man for four
this time he connects more fully, without much timing and collects one to mid on
Clarke can't find a big shot here, but he does collect one to cover
decent finish, but the earlier boundary made it a good over for Australia, here White digs out a yorker to cover and collects a single
White backs away, giving himself plenty of room to swing his big arms, but he can't quite time it and it trickles to cover
gone this time! White couldn't quite going and here he tried to smash a short ball out the ground, couldn't get much of it and Anderson took an easy catch on the square leg boundary
Clarke backs well away and Broad fires yorker well outside off, Clarke can't reach it, so oddly, it's a leave
another slower ball bouncer, and once again it's not timed, I'm not sure I've seen any of these slow bouncers timed, Clarke pulls it down to deep square
Hussey is away immediately, pushing down the ground for a single
good finish to a good spell from Broad, as Clarke bunts it down the ground for one
Clarke again has backed away and Anderson fires it in full outside off, Clarke can't reach it

well, suicidal running from Hussey. Clarke murdered a drive straight to Strauss at extra cover, Hussey ran for a single which was never these, Strauss calmly threw back to Anderson, who took the bails off and Hussey had no chance of getting back in time
good bowling from Anderson, landing those old-fashioned, death-over yorkers and Clarke can only jab it down the ground for one
goodness me, if Smith had connected here this ball would still be travelling, slow bouncer, and an enormous swipe is missed, went one-bounce to Kieswetter who fumbled and allowed a bye
oops! This must have just got stuck in Anderson's hands, it was so, so short, almost pitched on the bowler's feet, looped up miles over the batman, with enough time to collect a bye as well
oh dear, poor ball this, short and down the leg side, Smith helped it on its way and collected four
lovely shot to finish, really top shot, it was full and Smith whipped it into the gap in front of midwicket for four. Could be very important runs these last two balls
Clarke gets a single straight away, might just be best for Australia that, mistiming a drive to mid off
full and straight, good bowling, Smith squeezes out a drive and some top running allows him to come back for two
lovely shot, this innings could be a game-changer, he gets down on one knee and dinks it over the short fine leg for four
ha! well, he almost found the new gap, aiming a kind of switch-hit, but he couldn't connect
brilliant stuff this from Smith, conventional shot, just chipping a drive over cover and timing it perfectly to collect all four. Poor old Clarke will be stuck on 99
good ball from Bresnan to finish, yorker, Smith aims big and misses, Kieswetter collects and they run a bye to reach 290

inn2.comm: pace to start, but not much direction as he sprays one very wide of off stump from over the wicket
much better, on a length and fired at off stump. Strauss hops back to defend
shorter this time, not quite the bouncer but that leapt disconcertingly up at Strauss, who did very well to keep his eye on the ball and play it down
back of a length and very sharp. Strauss shapes to tuck the ball to leg but can't quite get it away, but Kieswetter calls him through for a quick single straight away
not quite adjusted to the change of line to the right-hander, as this one squirts down the leg side
ooh, almost the delivery he got him with in the last game. Very full, and very fast, but Kieswetter punches to mid on with the full face of the bat
width, and Kieswetter seizes upon it in fine fashion with a crunching cover drive. Right out the middle, and well-placed too, in the gap and away for four
a touch of width again, but he pulled the length back and Kieswetter is quite happy to leave
good start, on a length around off stump and Strauss defends back down the wicket
too short, and Strauss is in position in a flash to thump a pull up and over midwicket. He trusts the bounce in the wicket and went through with the shot
much fuller, and it's cracked to mid on
slapped away behind square on the off side! Bollinger is just feeding Strauss's strengths here, giving him width outside off and he's laced away behind point as a result
just keep it there! On a length, around off and nothing for Strauss to work with

Strauss shapes to clip to leg but is too early in the shot and gets himself in a bit of a tangle, and the ball heads back down the wicket instead. Bollinger leaps across in his follow-through to cut it off
emotive appeal first ball as he sends one down full and the ball strikes pad then bat as Kieswetter defends. Too close for the umpire to pick though, so not out
on a length, but on the hips and he's clipped to midwicket
nice, accurate stuff from Harris as Strauss chops defensively to point
fuller, and Strauss is drawn into a drive. Not quite there to be hit, though, and the ball goes softly to mid-off

good fielding from Ponting saves runs! That was even fuller and again Strauss launched into a drive, timing it much better this time, but the 35-year-old in the covers tumbles athletically to his left to cut it off
too straight, too full, and he's worked away to deep midwicket where Hussey cuts the ball off and hurls in a return
a touch full on off stump, Strauss drives firmly to mid-off
beaten outside off! Bollinger bends his back and finds some bounce outside off to beat a slightly airy woft by England's captain
aggressive from Strauss, as he backs to leg and slaps the ball to cover. Just the one run though
good stuff from Bollinger, as Kieswetter pushes at one angled across him and is beaten as well. He pulled the bat inside the line, but only after the ball was already past him
a touch fuller, and Kieswetter presses forward to defend. Probing stuff so far from Bollinger
full again, but pitching outside off and angled across him from over the wicket and Kieswetter raises his bat up and out of the way to leave
Strauss is beaten again outside off, but this time the ball was there to be hit. Short and wide, you'd back Strauss to put that away, but it just bounced a fraction more than he was expecting
Strauss misses a pull this time! Again, the shot was on, but now he plays over the top of it as the ball scoots over off stump
full on off stump, Strauss drives strongly down the ground but mid-off runs round in a flash to cut it off cleanly and keep them to one
watchful start from Kieswetter, who leaves alone outside off once again
off the inside edge, going between his back leg and the stumps and down to short fine leg. That was too close for comfort...
tight finish, zoning in on off stump and Kieswetter responds with a solid-looking forward defensive
very fast to start... but short and wide, and Strauss slams a cut over backward point to pick up four!

dropped! It was a good ball just outside off, Strauss pushes at it and gets a thick edge which flies to Watto at first slip... but he can't hold on! The ball was really motoring, but he just couldn't wrap the hands round it
punched to cover off the back foot
fuller this time, outside off, and driven - but straight to cover
wow, this has been a very quick over from Tait - high 90s mph. Strauss is hurried into a prod to cover
ah, the change-up to finish, as Tait sends down a slower-ball yorker outside off. I say slower, it was still around 80mph...
tapped to midwicket, and he's immediately called through for a quick single
on a length just outside off, and Strauss opens the face to send the ball to third man
Harris has been exemplary so far, hurling the ball down at good pace but finding accuracy too - and Kieswetter defends again
Kieswetter tries to relieve the pressure, shimmying to leg and flashing at the ball, which squirts off the outer half of the bat down to third man. Gully would've snaffled that
beaten outside off! Wasn't there for the cut, but he went for a flashing front-foot square drive. A little bit of seam movement and the ball whizzed past the edge
great intent from Strauss, as again he charges down the track to get to the pitch and cracks the ball very hard infront of square on the off side. Four runs! And shades of one Matty Hayden...
back of a length and quick, but Kieswetter hops into a backfoot defensive and plays the ball down under his eyes
shortish again, just outside off and Kieswetter pushes defensively to point
fuller this time, and Kieswetter is simply beaten for pace as he pushes half-forward to drive but the ball is upon him before he's properly into the shot, and trickles into the off side
feisty stuff! That was the bouncer, and was reasonably well-directed - not too short, and Kieswetter is hurried into a hook down to fine leg
Strauss shuffles across to the off side and works the ball straight to midwicket
full, and very fast indeed. Strauss pushes forward and opens the face to send the ball to backward point
too straight, Kieswetter glances to leg but can't beat the man at short fine
back of a length on off stump, and Kieswetter gets up on his toes to ride the bounce and defend to off

nicely played by Kieswetter, the ball was similar to the one before but this time he just angled the bat face to send the ball to third man's right. Tait runs around, but in the meantime they pick up two

clatter! Harris sent one down much fuller and Kieswetter went for the drive, leaving an enormous gap between bat and pad. There was a touch of wobble on the ball, and some seam movement in after pitching to squirt through the gap and smash into the top of off stump! Harris, who is obviously fired up, gives him a bit of a send-off
on a length, Pietersen moves nicely across and defends back down the track
slightly fuller, punched firmly to mid-off
a touch straight, and Strauss nudges him away behind square on the leg side.
so he sends one down short and wide on the off side, and Strauss cracks a cut right out of the middle of the bat to send the ball racing to the backward point boundary
closer to the stumps, and Strauss opens the face of the blade to guide the ball behind square on the off side
crack! Full, wide, and Pietersen absolutely hammers a drive through the covers. The ball raced to the boundary in a flash!
he pulls the length back a touch, but Pietersen drives on the up straight down the ground, beating a diving Ponting at mid-on! Two in two
thumped down the ground again! But that's clattered into the stumps at the non-striker's end, and the crowd let out a collective groan as the ball goes nowhere...
on a length, straight and pushed to mid-on

well, an uncharacteristically ungainly pull from Strauss as Harris sends one down a bit shorter. He found himself in no position to play the shot but just went through with it. That was a bit hoicky...

Harris strikes again! Pietersen went right across to the offside and aimed an extravagant flick over the leg-side but is struck on the back pad. Huge appeal from Australia, and the umpire agrees! Pietersen isn't happy, giving a long glance at the umpire as he trudges off, but that was stone dead, hitting middle and leg halfway up
nurdle to leg, and he's off the mark straight away
on a length on off stump, tapped defensively to cover
chopped down just behind square, backward point ran in but they committed to the single and it's safe in the end
just too straight, and Strauss nudges through midwicket, placing the ball well enough to warrant a second
back of a length on off, Strauss tries to guide the ball to third man but can't beat the man at gully
little shuffle to off, and worked to midwicket for one
very full outside off from over the wicket, Collingwood drives but the ball squirts off the toe-end of the bat and trickles to mid-off
Colly walks right across to the off side this time and unleashes a nurdle to leg, but straight to the fielder
walks across his stumps once again, and punches firmly to mid-on. More orthordox, less nurdley
worked to leg, in front of deep midwicket and so they charge through for the second. He couldn't pick the ball up cleanly anyway, so easy runs in the end
clipped straight to the close midwicket this time
chopped to gully, Colly was thinking about the cheeky single but Strauss sends him back
Strauss shuffles down the track and drives firmly past the straightish midwicket, but a deep-ish mid-on sprints round to cut the ball off
full, driven very hard on the up but straight to extra cover
mightily nurdled to leg, but straight to midwicket so no run
goes full to start, and Strauss drives a little leaden-footed to extra cover

edged and gone! Well, that curved away from Strauss very late to take the edge of his bat, and Paine takes a regulation catch behind. Tait strikes, and Australia continue to chip away at England as they chase a win that could at least give them some pride
quick, and Morgan toe-ends to slip, along the ground though
slightly wider of off, and Morgan leaves well alone
slightly wider still, and again Morgan leaves
fuller, and flashed behind square on the off side, but well-stopped by a tumbling backward point
nice start, full on off stump and slanting in to Collingwood, who defends towards point
slightly wider, Collingwood runs the ball down to third man
straight, and Morgan defends back down the track
thumped! Morgan is in a confident mood, as Hopes sends one down fuller and he lifts it handsomely way over long-on. Effortless, all balance and timing
and he follows that up with a little dink behind square to pick up the single
punched firmly to mid-off, where Bollinger just about cuts it off
Morgan is content at the moment to leave Tait's rockets alone outside off stump
this is swift stuff from Tait and Morgan hurries into a defensive block
no slower-ball bouncers from Tait, just full and very very quick, Morgan eases into a forward defence
this was a short one, but there was nothing slow about it, England look like they've decided to see Tait out, and Morgan sways out the way of it
this is actually short and wide outside off, I reckon any other bowler and Morgan would have had a dart at it, instead he leaves it alone
angles it across Morgan, who eagerly shoulders arms, which means Tait has bowled two maidens in a row now
Hopes lands his busy right-arm medium on and around off stump, Collingwood must recognise the bowling as reminiscent of his own, and guides it to third man for one
good ball here, nothing for Morgan to latch on to, so instead it's tapped gently back to the bowler
drifting a fraction down the leg side, Morgan tickles it round the corner for one
Collingwood managed to get this away for a couple, good calm stuff from him
this time it's on a line and length and Collingwood pushes it back to the bowler
good finish from Hopes and it's full-faced back to the bowler
ooh, close here, Morgan's greeted Smith by dancing down the wicket and flicking airily through midwicket, only just out the reach of a diving Ponting
this time it's more secure from Morgan, chipping down the crease again and working it for a single in front of square on the leg side
good ball from Smith, classic legspinner's stock, pitching around leg, spinning away, Collingwood is forward and blocks
too short and Collingwood cuts, firmly, but to the deep point fielder
poor ball, deserved more than it got, was very short and Morgan pulled hard but out to deep midwicket
good running from Collingwood earns two as he tickled this round the corner towards backward square leg
good from Hopes, nothing fancy, just busy, back of a length outside off and Morgan blocks
touch fuller, Morgan aims a drive but doesn't time it at all
good running again from these two, Morgan whipped it down to fine leg, where a good sliding stop on the boundary could have kept it to one, but he was back in a flash
nothing here, just dabbed into the cover region
once again Morgan looking for the leg-side whip, but can't connect and it thuds off the pads for a single
touch slower from Hopes and Collingwood eases it down to long on for a strike-stealing single
Collingwood committed to a sweep very early, but played the shot superbly, picking a gap at fine, fine leg and dabbing it just where he planned for four

great response from Smith and Collingwood has gone! Top stuff from Smith, but Collingwood looks unlucky here, he pushed forward to defend and the ball rapped him on the front pad, looked outside the line though
Yardy starts well enough, pushing into the covers for one
well, how about that! Lovely shot from Morgan, stuck his foot outside off stump and flicked it over midwicket for four
this time he plays the shot a touch more circumspectly, working it along the ground
finds the gap this time, picking a single into the leg side to keep the strike
good stuff from Hopes, maintaining a tight line and Morgan defends
this time Morgan manages to flick it to midwicket for a single
hopes really marching around busily, which suits his new shaven head, and lands this on middle stump for Yardy to defend
pushed across the left hander, was there for a cut shot, which Yardy plays, but misses
Yardy gets another chance to play the shot, and does so, guiding it down the third man for one
Hopes's military-medium is working well here, on off stump and Morgan can't squeeze a cut shot away
nicely played by Yardy, down on one knee and sweeping very crisply backward of square for four to bring up England's hundred
this time it's worked away into the midwicket region for a single
Morgan repeats the dose, nudging a single into the leg side
nicely bowled from Smith, flatter and quicker, Yardy played it very carefully towards mid on for one
Morgan keeps England ticking with a gentle push in front of the wicket on the leg side for a  single
nicely bowled, touch of air and thrown up outside off inviting a drive, Yardy obliged and didn't time it
good cricket this, more bustling, accurate medium from Hopes, Morgan flicks it in front of square on the leg side to collect a couple
this time it's a tighter line and Morgan can only defend
Morgan tries to manufacture something here, giving himself some room, but he's hurried on a cut shot and can't time it
cracking stuff from Hopes, giving nothing away, Morgan can only defend
ooh, the pressure almost told there, Morgan sliced an airy drive, but it avoided the fielders and he collected a couple to deep cover
good finish from Hopes, on a length, on a line and Morgan defends
Yardy will be pleased with this, picking the gap in front of square on the leg side with a crisp sweep to collect a couple
touch short from Smith, in less circumspect times Yardy might have had a swipe at that, here he is content to push for a single to mid on
nothing for Morgan here as he defends quietly off the front foot
thrown up well outside off again, Morgan watches it turn and deftly nudges a single
this time it's spinning down the leg side, Yardy helps it on its way but some swift fielding on the fine leg boundary keeps it to one
another single, worked behind square on the leg side
Australia really rushing through their overs here, Hopes continues and Morgan flips this behind him for one
good from Yardy, nothing fancy, just pushing the ball into some space towards mid on for one
touch too short, Morgan latched on to a pull shot in a flash, but picked out deep midwicket
nicely bowled from Hopes, a touch slower outside off and Yardy was through his drive too quickly, Paine, standing up to the stumps, couldn't collect cleanly, so they stole a bye
fuller here and Morgan bunted it down the ground for a gentle single
Hopes round the wicket this time, trying to cramp Yardy for room, it works, in a way, but the mistimed cut trickles for a swift single
almost squeezes through first ball, swinging in a fraction and forcing Yardy to play around his front pad, almost gets through but a touch of wood send it to midwicket for one
well, if Morgan has a weakness it could be in that area, just hanging outside off stump and Morgan fences at it
much fuller this time, Morgan more comfortable, working it to mid on
oh dear, grubber! Pitched on a decent length and burrowed under Morgan's bat through to Paine
Morgan tells himself to 'watch the ball' as Bollinger runs up, sound advice at any level, he watches it all the way on to his bat and flicks to square leg for one
Yardy is shuffling all over the place, eventually he ends up in an orthodox position, but duly plays and misses
this will help! Morgan planted his front foot down the ground and swung hard across the line, pinging it into the crowds over deep midwicket
and again! Even bigger this time, Morgan cleared his front leg and smashed it over a straight midwicket a long, long way
slower ball this time, and Morgan mistimes a drive down the ground
this time he collects one, knocking into space
Yardy leans forward and squirts a defensive prod towards point for a single
single to finish the over, pushed into space on the off side
plenty of shouts from the fielders as Yardy backed up a long way, Morgan punched into the covers
neatly done here from Morgan to bring up the 50 stand, pushed to long on for one
touch shorter from Bollinger, climbs on Yardy and he mistimes an attempted work to leg, trickles out on the off side
good ball from Bollinger, fuller and straighter, Yardy jabs out a defence
full, straight ball is met by a full, straight bat, as Yardy pushes this to mid off
very good over from Bollinger, after the flow of runs in the last over this over was an important one and it only went for one
very good take by Paine down the leg side, and Harris is probably lucky to get away with it, looked wide.

the bowling change works and Morgan has gone! That could well be it! Harris has made the difference today, and this was full and outside off stump, inviting the flashing drive, but Morgan could only get a faint outside edge through to Paine.
starts with an uncertain forward block and Australia are full of beans
full and swinging in a touch, Wright tries to flap it away into the leg side but can't get much on it
outside off stump this time, and Wright leaves it well alone
wicket maiden from Harris, really top over that. Wright leans into a crisp forward block
Yardy greets him with an attempted sweep, which he doesn't connect with
another dot ball, this time more carefully played back to the bowler
nicely played here, a very careful cover drive, timed for a couple
Yardy on the sweep again, and the ball drifts wide of off stump, leaving Yardy unable to connect
this time he works a single into the leg side
full and Wright tickles it round the corner for a single
short, wide, and slapped very hard but out to the cover sweeper
driven to the off side, out of the middle of the bat but straight to extra cover

Yardy drops the ball at his feet and wanders down, thinking about the single, but Hopes sprints forward and flicks the ball back at the stumps to send him scampering back to the crease. A direct hit would have been very close
straightish, Yardy tries to work the ball to midwicket but it thumps into the top of the pad
chopped down behind square on the off side for a single
quite wide, but no damage - tapped softly to point off the front foot
floated up well wide of off stump and Yardy slams a drive through the covers, hitting it well enough to beat the boundary sweeper
paddle-swept quite fine, but just the single as the man runs round
flighted on middle and off, and Wright defends

bowled round his legs! Smith has been getting really nice drift, and this has just curved slightly down the leg side and then spun back across to strike the middle and leg stumps. Wright tried to clip to leg but the drift took the ball away from the bat, and some spin did the rest! Another one down for England
Bresnan looks to get off the mark with a nudge behind square on the off side, but straight to the fielder
flicked through square leg, and he will get off the mark this time
punched out to deep cover
curves one in to strike the pad, big appeal but not given. May have struck him just outside the line
chance for a run-out! It was dropped into the covers and they just set off, Ponting swooped in a flash and threw with Bresnan well short, but couldn't hit the stumps
slices a cut away behind square, third man runs round but can't cut it off and that's four! Bresnan still believes...
better ball, full on off stump and Bresnan defends
pushed to point, loud "no!" from Yardy
full and wide, flashed away square but it's cut off by the sweeper, running to his right
pushed down to long-on for an easy single
well-placed from Bresnan, who just hangs back in the crease and forces the ball away behind point. Some energetic running gets him two
pushed into the covers off the back foot
pushed too wide this time, and the drift took it even further
closer to the stumps this time, and Yardy picks up a single with a firm push through the covers
driven down to long-off
sent out to the cover sweeper with a meaty thump
pushed down to long-on for an ambled single
short and pulled away square, not quite out of the middle though and so it's easily cut off
squirts off the inside edge and lands at Yardy's feet, Hopes charges across to stop any thoughts of a cheeky single
pushed softly to mid-off: softly enough for them to have time to sneak in a single
off the inside edge of Bresnan's bat now, but this time it rolls down to fine leg
starts with a short ball, which Bresnan pulls - not altogether convincingly - to deep midwicket, where a superb effort from Smith keeps the ball from crossing the boundary
banged in and the extra effort means he overstepped
down the leg side and glanced away past the keeper
comes forward and pushes into the off side
touch short and clubbed towards mid on who makes a diving stop
outside off and driven firmly to cover
width again and another drive to cover, but this time Clarke can't stop it and long-off has to tidy up
on off stump, pushed out to the cover sweeper
tighter to off stump and Yardy eases it down the ground to keep the strike
back of a length on off stump, opens the face to backward point
beaten outside off by a very full delivery as he tries to run it to third man
defended into the crease by his feet and he's called through by an alert Bresnan
full and homing in on off stump, Bresnan drives firmly up to mid-off
banged in very short outside off stump and the umpire lets him get away with it
back on a length at off stump, defended to cover to end a tight over
Yardy opens the face on the blade and tries to run it down, but finds backward point
top-edged sweep, but over the 'keepers head and down fine
quicker and very full - a yorker - and Bresnan jams the bat down to send the ball into the covers
driven firmly down to long-off
quick, but too short and Bresnan stays deep in the crease and muscles the ball out to deep cover
swept right out the middle, but along the ground and straight to the man at deep square leg
short on off stump, Yardy backs away to leg and cuts out to deep point for four!
ooh, he stands at the crease this time and Bollinger keeps his line, this time beating the edge as Yardy tries to nudge to third man
backs away again, Bollinger goes full this time and Yardy slices the ball down to third man
Bollinger comes round the wicket to Bresnan, who chops down to third man to rotate the strike
hacked out to deep midwicket, they briefly consider a second but that would have been foolhardly
back of a length on off, Bresnan aims to swipe over cover but misses completely
fifty for Michael Yardy, and he's played rather well, his first significant effort with the bat for England since his comeback, but it'd take a lot more to give England a chance
Harris strikes again, what a game he's having! Bresnan attempted to clear the one man at deep long on, curious shot-selection really, and he ended up skiing it straight to Watson on the boundary
Yardy keeps swinging, and this only just passes mid on, once it beats the infield though, it skips along the quick outfield for four
follows up the boundary with by squeezing a full ball behind point for a single
touch shorter here from Harris, Swann nudges it off his hip for a single to midwicket
Yardy backs away and aims a gentle drive and gets a single to mid off
full and angled in from round the wicket, Yardy is backing away again and squeezes it out to point for a single
and another one goes! Bollinger is too sharp for Swann! Bounced up into the rib area, Swann tried to fend it away and could only glove it behind to Paine
almost goes first ball as Bollinger, who is really racing in, arrows a yorker into Broad's pads, it was slipping down leg, however, and thudded off the pads for one
Yardy gone this time! Short and Yardy pulls without much timing straight to mid on
Anderson doesn't see much of his first delivery, zipping past his hanging bat and going through to Paine
Bollinger lands a yorker which Anderson manages to dig out
Harris has really bustled in, full of pace and effort, and this hurries Broad into an uncomfortable defence
touch shorter here, Broad swats, a touch aimlessly, and gets a top-edge that sails over the keeper for four
clears his front leg, and aims a big heave outside off stump, but misses
That's it! Harris has five and Australia break their duck! Broad chips it tamely to cover where Hussey takes the catch.
